Posts.Content: Karen1967 wrote: First of all I would like to thank everyone on this website! I found this site while searching for info on calcifications.  Here's my background info.  I'm 42.  On maternal side, an aunt that had BC,  a great great aunt that died from BC, and a paternal great aunt that had BC.  I have fibrocystic breasts and my left one has been getting bigger.  At yearly gyno exam, doctor noticed and said to make sure I was getting my yearly mammo.  I had my screening mammo on 2/18 and received a call from doctor stating they found some calcifications in left breast and need follow-up mammogram.  I had my diagnostic mammo yesterday.  The radiologist show me the original views which showed two small areas with clusters of calcifications.  She said they wanted magnified views.  She took the views and spoke with the doctor.  I was expecting the doctor who looked at the views to discuss what she saw with me but the radiologist came back and said the doctor said, "she doesn't think it's anything to worry about so she putting a negative on the report and to come back in a year."  Should I be okay with these results?  At first I was relieved, but now I'm starting to worry again. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Doctor doesn't think it's "anything to worry about" Karen1967 victoriasecret

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2010 10:19AM Karen1967 wrote: Thanks everyone for your thoughts!  I called my doctor to have them read the results to me since I didn't actually speak to the radiologist and hoped that the report would give me peace of mind (maybe what the radiologist told the person who relayed the results to me got lost in translation.)  The doctors office read the report and actually told me not to wait a year.  They suggested either a 6 mth follow-up mammo or seeing a breast surgeon.  They told me to find out what my ins covered.  I did and both are covered.  I let my doctor know and they set me up with an appt to a breast surgeon for this Thurs.  I'll let you know the results.  Thanks again for all of your support!
Posts.Title: Doctor doesn't think it's "anything to worry about" Karen1967 victoriasecret
